explainer: Yes - Early models of the 360 sometimes encountered hardware issues that would prevent the console from even turning on. When the console experienced a problem that required service from Microsoft, it would light up three of the four arc segments that were arranged in a ring around the power button. Mirroring the Windows “Blue Screen of Death,” Xbox gamers would come to refer to this hardware failure as the “Red Ring of Death.”
